--- title: "Megan Coden" description: | _Software engineer and bioinformatician dedicated to leveraging technology to advance biological research and innovation_ date-format: 'MMM YYYY' execute: echo: false output: false freeze: auto title-block-banner: true toc: true toc-location: left page-layout: full listing: - id: presentations contents: presentations.yml type: table fields: [event, title, location, date, authors, format] sort-ui: false filter-ui: false field-display-names: title: Title date: Date authors: Authors event: Event location: Location format: Type - id: publications contents: publications.yml type: table fields: [authors, year, title, location] sort-ui: false filter-ui: false field-display-names: authors: Authors year: Date title: Title location: Publication Location - id: awards contents: awards.json type: table fields: [award, dates, amount] sort-ui: false filter-ui: false field-display-names: award: Award dates: Dates amount: Amount --- # Education {.cvHeading}

University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI --- April 2023

_Bachelor of Science with High Distinction_ --- GPA: 3.99

Major: Computer Science

Major: Honors in Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology

# Skills {.cvHeading}

Languages: Python, R, JavaScript, TypeScript, SQL, C++, C, C#, Swift, Bash, HTML, CSS, LaTeX

Frameworks: React, Angular, .NET, Flask, FastAPI, R Markdown, Node.js, Quarto

Tools: GitHub, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, GraphQL, REST, Terraform, Meilisearch, MongoDB, Conda/Mamba, SLURM

Bioinformatics & Data Analysis: large-scale genomic dataset analysis, machine learning (mikropml), statistical modeling (R, NumPy), data visualization (ggplot2), pipeline development (Snakemake), database management

Software: test-driven development, object oriented programming, continuous integration/continuous deployment, documentation, collaboration, peer review, agile methodology, cloud computing, web and mobile development

# Experience {.cvHeading}

Optum

Associate Software Engineer (2024 - Present)

  • Created an internal website to enforce engineering excellence principles and streamline development, deployment, and maintenance across teams. Presented at DevDays (internal technology conference), increasing project adoption.
  • Refactored API using module design pattern, enhancing code maintainability and scalability.
  • Implemented Jest testing to enhance software reliability.
  • Overhauled core feature by redesigning the database schema, updating the UI, and adding caching, reducing load times by over 90%. Performed data migration to ensure backwards compatibility.
  • Earned AWS Cloud Foundations certification, gaining expertise in cloud infrastructure and migration.
  • Onboarded four new team members. Performed code reviews to ensure high-quality code integration.

Software Engineering Associate (2023 - 2024)

  • Built a chatbot UI in TypeScript, integrating with a FastAPI backend for secure OpenAI communication.
  • Collaborated with UI/UX team to design and develop a user-friendly email automation website.
  • Presented project milestones to senior executives in biweekly leadership demos.
  • Architected and developed a reusable checklist feature enforcing engineering best practices.
  • Created and maintained CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and cron automation, reducing manual deployment efforts.
  • Mentored six interns, imparting skills in leadership, networking, and navigating their careers.
  • Organized team-building activities, including an office-wide “Survivor” game, fostering community.

ACI Transport

Software Engineer (2023 - 2024)

  • Dockerized a multi-application system using Docker Compose; enabled local testing of individual services.
  • Developed features in an Angular application with a .NET backend using C# and JavaScript. Conducted xUnit and regression tests.

University of Michigan

Bioinformatics Research Assistant - Schloss Research Lab (2021 - 2023)

  • Trained machine learning models using mikropml (R package) and Snakemake reproducible workflow to predict severity of _C. difficile_ infections based on the composition of patients’ gut microbiomes.
  • Analyzed model performance using AUROC and AUPRC curves generated in R.
  • Developed reproducible workflows to streamline analysis of continuously evolving genomic datasets, improving efficiency and scalability.
  • Presented at research symposiums, earning second place at the Microbiology and Immunology Undergraduate Research Symposium and a travel award at the Undergraduate Research Symposium.

Undergraduate Research Assistant - Montgomery Research Lab (2020 - 2021)

  • Collaborated with Zimmerman lab to perform computational analysis of the interference of catalysts in glycoside synthesis pathways using Athena (software).
  • Computed thermodynamic feasibility and informed lab members about effective polysaccharide synthesis.
# Teaching and Outreach {.cvHeading}

Instructional Aide - EECS 281 (2021 - 2023)

  • Taught weekly discussion section for 30-40 students about concepts related to lecture material.
  • Assisted students individually during office hours. Mentored students as they debugged their 1000+ line projects, structure code, and select data structures.
  • Managed administrative team of seven instructional aides. Primary liaison between students and professors. Coordinated room assignments and assigned staff members to lab sections.
  • Devised exam questions. Evaluated student performance on exams.

MRADS/WISE RP Study Group Leader (2020 - 2021)

  • Guided virtual study groups each week for Math 116 students. Designed worksheets and introduced calculus concepts.
# Presentations {.cvHeading} :::{#presentations} ::: # Publications {.cvHeading} :::{#publications} ::: # Awards and Scholarships {.cvHeading} ```{js} const data = await FileAttachment('awards.json').json(); console.log(data); ``` ```{ojs} const data = await FileAttachment('awards.json').json(); Inputs.table(data) ```
